code: @Manual{,   title = {gvsu215: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts},   author = {Ian Curtis},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/ian-curtis/gvsu215, https://ian-curtis.github.io/gvsu215/}, }

what: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts
title: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts
text: gvsu215 contains series wrapper functions around select mosaic ggformula functions, help flextable. goal provide introductory statistics students/learners easy way generate nice-looking plots tables without focusing code used create . tables plots generated package doctored themes pre-applied. , output print “messy” format R console can used interactively, including R Markdown documents. package designed tailored Grand Valley State University (course code: STA 215) can used anyone.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts
text: can install development version gvsu215 GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ian-curtis/gvsu215")

title: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts
text: order use package, need basic understanding R syntax run function preferred working environment. Functions use formula syntax (e.g., var1 ~ var2) thus knowledge formulas needed well.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts For Basic Statistical Concepts
text: package best used creating simple plots charts extensive customization necessary. instance, may just want see summary statistics. code: library(gvsu215)  num_sum(mtcars, ~wt, na_rm = TRUE) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'mosaic': #>   method                           from    #>   fortify.SpatialPolygonsDataFrame ggplot2 pctile(mtcars, ~wt, probs = c(0, .25, .4, .5, .6, .75, 1)) plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "percent") plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear, fill = 'orangered4', x = "Gear", y = "Weight", title = "Boxplot of Weight by Gear") plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat) #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots. infer_prop1(mtcars, ~vs, success = 1) infer_paired(mtcars, var1 = ~drat, var2 = ~wt) infer_mean2_int(mtcars, wt~vs) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear)) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear, type = "expected")) infer_anova(mtcars, cyl~gear, digits = 2)

code: check_conf_lvl(level)

text: level confidence level question

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: Nothing, error message.

title: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
code: check_conf_lvl(.95) try(check_conf_lvl("95%")) #> Error in check_conf_lvl("95%") :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive (not in quotes). try(check_conf_lvl(95)) #> Error in check_conf_lvl(95) :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive (not in quotes).

what: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Used internally check error might occur later. catch error provide helpful message users based common cause errors.

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: check_test(code)

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: code code try run

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Nothing, error message.

title: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: library(stats)  check_test(head(mtcars)) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1 try(check_test(head(Mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.  check_test(lm(wt~drat, data = mtcars)) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = wt ~ drat, data = mtcars) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)         drat   #>       7.906       -1.304   #>  try(check_test(lm(Wt~drat, data = mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.

title: Create percentile summaries — pctile

title: Create percentile summaries — pctile
code: pctile(   data,   formula,   digits = 3,   probs = c(0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1),   caption = NULL,   na_rm = FALSE )

title: Create percentile summaries — pctile
text: data data frame (tibble). formula Variables summarize given formula notation: ~var1 var1~var2. var1 numeric var2, supplied, grouping variable. digits number digits round . Defaults 3. probs vector percentiles compute. value must 0 1, inclusive. Defaults 0, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%. caption override table caption. sensible default given. na_rm missing values removed?
